text: everyday vocabulary topic cats my family
has fish I enjoy watching them swim
around in the aquarium but sometimes my
children wish for a different kind of
pet we can't have cats because my son is
allergic to cats the only cats in this
house are stuffed animals like these
they're cute
they have whiskers paws they're soft so
you can pet them and you can cuddle them
too but of course they don't purr when
they're happy but I'd rather have these
cats than real cats which would make my
son sneeze
besides fish are easier to take care of
do you know how to care for a cat let me
show you first of all cats need a litter
box inside you don't take them outside
for a walk as you do with dogs and they
need food and water so you have to fill
their food dish and change the water in
their water bowl most cats like to play
so most cat owners buy cat toys
many cats enjoy using a scratching post
if you have a scratching post like this
your cat can jump on it climb on it play
on it like this cat and of course
scratch it
cats have claws as you know when those
claws get too sharp and too long you
need to clip them cats require grooming
you need to brush its coat to keep it
clean and shiny and of course almost all
cats shed fur now listen and repeat
cat if you have a cat and it stays
inside you have a house cat you can also
say an indoor cat if you let your cat go
outside it's an outdoor cat and a cat
with no home is a stray cat whiskers
paws the cat is licking its paw breed
meaning the kind of cat a common
question is what kind of cat do you have
litter box clean the litter box cat food
cat food often comes in either a can or
a bag water bowl you fill the water bowl
cat toys common movements of cats
include pouncing a cat can pounce a cat
can stretch and a cat can rub against
something you can rub against your leg
or your hand
some movements of cat owners include
petting you can pet a cat you can
scratch a cat behind its ears and you
can cuddle a cat cat sounds include
meowing a cat can meow a cat can purr a
cat can yell a cat can hiss when it's
scared or angry clip-clip a cat's claws
use a clipper fur a cat sheds fur
we have short-haired cats and long
haired cats
brush brush a cat's fur brush a cat's
coat groom a cat
